This group of services provides functionality that enables an Airline to
present offers and give the passenger the possibility to build an
itinerary and book the itinerary.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Shopping Services

Nodes.Text:
To make use of the services and book flights (simple booking scenario),
use the services in the following order:

Obtain search criteria from the passenger and submit a
[/products/air/search]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/search)
request, POST operation to get a list of flights matching the search
criteria. Display the returned flights to the passenger.

This request creates a session and a conversation. From the response, collect the execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which you will use in subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
The response also includes a ShoppingBasketHashCode for each flight.

After the passenger selects one or more flights, use the [/products/air]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/flightDetails) POST operation to add the flights to the itinerary and store the
itinerary in the session.

Use the hash codes for the passenger-selected flights to identify the flights in the POST operation. Use the GET operation to retrieve the itinerary, or additional POST operations to
update the itinerary.

Anytime in the session (if the itinerary has been stored), call a [/products]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getBreakdown)
operation to obtain a current list with prices of products that
the passenger has added to the itinerary. Use this information to build and display a shopping cart.
You can build and display a shopping cart on every page of the passenger's interface.
After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /passengers operations to add passengers to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/passengers]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/changePassengers) POST request to add passengers to an itinerary.
  * You can also use POST to update by submitting all of the passenger data including the updated fields, and to delete passengers from the itinerary by submitting all of the passenger data, including blank fields for the deleted passengers.
* Submit a [/passengers]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getPassengers) GET request to display the current passenger data for the itinerary.

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /products/ancillaries operations to show passengers the ancillaries available on the flights they have selected and to add any ancillaries selected by the passenger to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/products/ancillaries]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getAncillaries) GET request to obtain a list of ancillaries available for the flights in the itinerary. You can display these ancillaries to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/products/ancillaries]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/updateAncillaries) POST request to add ancillaries to the itinerary.
  * You can also use POST to update by submitting all of the ancillary data including the updated fields, and to delete ancillaries from the itinerary by submitting all of the ancillary data, including blank fields for the deleted ancillaries.

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /products/seats operations to show passengers the seats available on the flights they have selected and to add any seats selected by the passenger to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/products/seats]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getSeatsMap) GET request to the information used to construct seat maps for the flights in the itinerary. The seat information indicates available seats and reserved seats, free seats and paid seats, and so on.
  * You can use this information to format a seat map for display to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/products/seats]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/selectSeats) POST request to add seats to the itinerary.
  * You can also use POST to update by submitting all of the seat data including the updated fields, and to delete seats from the itinerary by submitting all of the seat data, including blank fields for the deleted seats.
After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session, including ancillaries and seats use /paymentOptions to retrieve available FOPs.

* Submit a [/paymentOptions]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getCombinability) GET request to obtain a list of available forms of payment (FOP) and amounts (surcharges included).
  * You can display these forms of payment to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/paymentOptions]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/calculateSecondFopResidualValues) POST request to send FOP code with amount to get in the response a list with all combinable forms of payment with amount (residual amount).

After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session, including ancillaries and seats, collect payment data from the passenger and submit a
[/purchase]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/purchaseBooking) POST request.
The /purchase request submits billing data to the FOPs supplied by the passenger and, if the payment is authorized, creates a PNR.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Shopping Services

Nodes.Text:
The Frequent Traveler Award Redemption flow allows Frequent
Travelers to access their mileage balance and redeem those miles for points they can use during purchase. *Digital Connect* retrieves passengers profile with the available points.
When redeeming miles from passengers account, *Digital Connect* adds the certificate and award information to the historical remarks field of the reservation.
Passengers can redeem miles when:

* booking a new reservation
* editing an existing reservation

The /paymentOptions/details/AWARD service provides the minimum and maximum quantity of points to pay for a flight. It also returns possible combinations of points and amount, which the client may use to MFOP.

The passenger after flight/ancillaries/seats selection can switch to points to be able to pay for booking or part of the booking using Award FOP. During the switch, reprice of the current reservation is done and products breakdown in points is returned. To be able to switch, the passenger needs to be logged in first and have sufficient balance. If after switch
to points the passenger changes anything in reservation (adds/removes ancillaries/seats), reservation is automatically switched back to cash. The passenger has to switch again to points to reprice updated reservation to points.

Nodes.Title: What can you do with Payment Options AWARD API?

Nodes.Text:
The /paymentOptions/details/AWARD service provides the following
functionality:

* Call GET [/paymentOptions/details/AWARD]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getAwardDetails) to return possible combinations of points and cash and current toggle buttons state
* Call POST [/paymentOptions/deatils/AWARD]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/setAwardAmount) to set the fare slider and the toggles button selections.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: What can you do with Payment Options AWARD API?

Nodes.Title: Book Now Pay Later Flow (B2C: BNPL)

Nodes.Text: The Book Now Pay Later flow enables Airlines to allow passengers to create a booking and put it on hold for a specified time limit. The passenger can pay for the booking later. This flow supports the ability for Airlines to configure a fee that passengers would pay for using the option to put the booking on hold and pay later.

During shopping, this feature determines which of the products
selected by the passenger are eligible for Book Now Pay Later. It also updates the itinerary when the passenger selects this
option.

**NOTE**
If there is a seat booked in the on-hold PNR, the passenger cannot change it or add a new one during the purchase.
The same applies to ancillaries and insurance.
BNPL needs to be called in the Revenue (B2C) flow, after completing passenger's details.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Book Now Pay Later Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the services and put created booking on hold, use the services in the following order:

Use the [/products/bnpl]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/getHoldOptions) service to determine which of the products selected by the passenger held in the current itinerary (in the current session) are eligible for
book now pay later (BNPL) and what the applicable BNPL fee would be. Use this information to populate display for the passenger.

The [/products/bnpl/purchase]($e/%2F%20%28Booking%20B2C%2FRBE%29/purchase) service submits any part of the current itinerary that the passenger has selected for on-hold purchase, including the hold type and the payment
method. If successful, the service creates a PNR with on-hold status.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Book Now Pay Later Flow Services

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking – Book Now Pay Later Flow (MYB: BNPL)

Nodes.Text: Book Now Pay Later (BNPL) flow is also referred to as "on hold".
Passengers who retrieve bookings in the MYB Flow of BNPL are able to complete the purchase of a booking that was previously put on hold.
*Digital Connect* gives Airlines an option to support the completion of BNPL purchases:

* an option to purchase on-hold PNRs which contain seats and/or ancillaries, and/or insurance (important: only insurance sold as an ancillary when an Airline is a Merchant of Record can be put on-hold).
* an option to add ancillaries, seats and/or insurance when completing the purchase of an on-hold PNRs which do not contain any of them.
**NOTES**

* If there is a seat booked in the on-hold PNR, the passenger cannot change it or add any new ones during the purchase. The same applies to ancillaries and insurance.
* Any changes that the passenger makes to their reservation are reflected in the PNR. After each modification, the passenger's shopping cart is updated to show the old and new selections together with their prices.

* The passenger has an option to retrieve a booking and purchase  flight previously put on hold.
* The passenger supplies the information needed to retrieve the booking.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Manage Your Booking - Book Now Pay Later Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To use the Book Now Pay Later services and complete the purchase of selected booking, call the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
After the passenger selects booking previously placed on hold, use [/pnr/bnpl]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/retrievePnr) GET request to initialize the Book Now Pay Later process and retrieve requested booking.

This request  creates a session and a conversation. From the response, collect the execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which can be used in the subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
The response header contains an Execution key used to keep session information later on (e.g. Execution: e1s1).

At any time after an itinerary has been stored in the session, use a [/pnr/bnpl/products]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/getBreakdown) GET operation to obtain a current list of prices of products that the passenger has added to the itinerary. Use this information to build and display the shopping cart. The shopping cart can be built and displayed on every page of the passengers' interface.

**NOTE**
pnr/bnpl/products GET can be submitted at any time if an itinerary is stored in the user session.

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /pnr/bnpl/products/ancillaries operations to show passengers the ancillaries available on the flights they have selected, and to add any ancillaries selected by the passenger to the itinerary (if they were not previously selected in the B2C flow).

* Submit a [/pnr/bnpl/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/getAncillaries) GET request to obtain a list of ancillaries available for the flights in the itinerary. These ancillaries to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/bnpl/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/updateAncillaries) POST request to add ancillaries to the itinerary. POST can also be used to update by submitting all of the ancillary data including the updated fields, and to delete ancillaries from the itinerary by submitting all of the ancillary data, including blank fields for the deleted ancillaries.

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /pnr/bnpl/products/seats operations to show passengers the seats available on the flights they have selected and to add any seats selected by the passenger to the itinerary (if they were not previously selected in the B2C flow).

* Submit a [/pnr/bnpl/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/getSeatsMap) GET request to obtain full information about seats on selected flight. The seat information indicates available seats and reserved seats, free seats, paid seats, etc. You can use this information to format a seat map for display to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/bnpl/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/selectSeats) POST request to add seats to the itinerary. POST can also be used to update seats by submitting all of the seat data including the updated fields, and to delete seats from the itinerary by submitting all of the seat data, including blank fields for the deleted seats.
After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session including ancillaries and seats use /pnr/bnpl/paymentOptions to retrieve available FOPs.

* Submit a [/pnr/bnpl/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/getPaymentOptions) GET request to obtain a list of available forms of payment (FOP) and amounts (surcharges included). These forms of payment can be displayed  to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/bnpl/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/calculateSecondFopResidualValues) POST request to send FOP code with amount to get in the response a list with all combinable forms of payment with amount (residual amount).

After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session including ancillaries and seats, collect payment data from the passenger and submit a [/pnr/bnpl/purchase]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fbnpl/purchaseBooking) request.
The /pnr/bnpl/purchase request submits billing data to the FOPs supplied by the passenger and, if payment is authorized, adds remarks to the PNR.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Manage Your Booking - Book Now Pay Later Flow Services
Manage Your Booking Book Now Pay Later (MYB: BNPL)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking – Change Itinerary Flow (MYB: CI)

Nodes.Text: This group of services provides functionality that enables an Airline to present existing bookings for modifications by passengers. Passengers who retrieve bookings can exchange booked flights.
*Digital Connect* gives Airlines an option to support exchanges in the Manage Your Booking: Change Itinerary (MYB: CI) flow.

* Only simple PNRs without any ancillaries, seats and insurance are supported during an exchange.
* Only single credit card FOP is supported during an exchange.
* Only additional collection and even exchanges (plus residual value scenario - refund to a single FOP, i.e. credit card only) are supported.
* During an exchange, the passenger has an ability to add:
  * seats
  * ancillaries
* The passenger can modify the passenger details and SSRs while selecting a new booking or modifying an existing one.

* The Airline gives the passenger an option to retrieve a booking and exchange booked flights.
* The passenger supplies the information needed to retrieve the booking.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Manage Your Booking – Change Itinerary Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the exchange booked flights services, use them in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.
The passenger can select itinerary to be exchanged.
After the passenger selects one or more flights to be exchanged, Airline call [/pnr/exchange]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/retrievePnr) request GET operation to initialize the Exchange process.

This request creates a session and a conversation. From the response, collect the execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which you will use in subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
In the response header you get Execution key that is used to keep session information later on (e.g. Execution: e1s1).

When the passenger selects search criteria, submit [pnr/exchange/products/air/search]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/searchExchange) request POST operation to get a list of flights matching the search criteria.
The returned flights are displayed to the passenger.
The response also includes a **ShoppingBasketHashCode** for each flight.

After the passenger selects one or more flights, call the [/pnr/exchange/products/air]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/select) POST operation to add the flights to the itinerary and store the itinerary in the session.

If the itinerary has been stored in the session, call [/pnr/exchange/products]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/getBreakdown) GET operation to obtain a current list, with prices of products that the passenger has added to the itinerary.
Use this information to build and display the shopping cart.

If the itinerary has been stored in the session, call [/pnr/exchange/passengers]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/exchangePassengers) POST operation to change some passengers details (e.g. FF number, Contact Details, Email address, Travel Doc info, etc.).

* Submit a [/pnr/exchange/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/getAncillaries) GET request to obtain a list of ancillaries available on the flights they have exchanged. These ancillaries to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/exchange/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/updateAncillaries) POST request to add ancillaries to the itinerary. POST can also be used to update by submitting all of the ancillary data including the updated fields, and to delete ancillaries from the itinerary by submitting all of the ancillary data, including blank fields for the deleted ancillaries.
If the original reservation contains ancillaries (i.e. paid Ancillaries with EMD(s) issued), check if the re-association criteria are met:

* same carrier code (operating)
* origin and destination points
* direct to indirect flight exchange
* connecting flight to connecting flights exchange (same connecting point),
* price
Full Exchange – OneWay – Unflown

* EMD-S for FOP Surcharge – no re-association involved
* Free to paid – verification only – the passenger is able to select new ancillaries
* Paid to paid:
  * The passenger already has ancillaries in the original reservation
    * validation if the same ancillaries were selected for all segments
    * ancillaries (AEs) are re-associated to the OLD EMD (no new EMD)
    * the OLD EMD is re-associated to NEW VCR after exchange
  * The passenger adds new ancillaries:
    * ancillaries (AEs) are added to the PNR
    * the NEW EMD is created
Full Exchange – RT – all segments Unflown

* EMD-S for FOP Surcharge – no re-association involved
* Free to paid – verification only – the passenger is able to select new ancillaries
* Paid to paid:
  * The passenger already has ancillaries in the original reservation
    * validation if the same ancillaries were selected for all segments
    * ancillaries (AEs) are re-associated to the OLD EMD (no new EMD)
    * the OLD EMD is re-associated to the NEW VCR after exchange
  * The passenger adds new ancillaries:
    * ancillaries (AEs) are added to the PNR
    * the NEW EMD is created

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /pnr/exchange/products/seats operations to show passengers the seats available on the flights they have exchanged and to add any seats selected by the passenger to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/pnr/exchange/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/getSeatsMap) GET request to obtain full information about seats on selected flight. The seat information indicates available seats and reserved seats, free seats, paid seats, etc. You can use this information to format a seat map for display to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/exchange/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/selectSeats) POST request to add seats to the itinerary. POST can also be used to update seats by submitting all of the seat data including the updated fields, and to delete seats from the itinerary by submitting all of the seat data, including blank fields for the deleted seats.
After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session including ancillaries and seats use /pnr/exchange/paymentOptions to retrieve available FOPs.

* Submit a [/pnr/exchange/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/getCombinability) GET request to obtain a list of available forms of payment (FOP) and amounts (surcharges included). These forms of payment can be displayed  to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/exchange/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/calculateSecondFopResidualValues) POST request to send FOP code with amount to get in the response a list with all combinable forms of payment with amount (residual amount).

After the passenger has completed exchange process with changing the itinerary in the session
(including exchange process for the ancillaries and seats),
collect payment data from the passenger and  submit a [/pnr/exchange/purchase]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fexchange/purchaseBooking) request, POST operation.
The /pnr/exchange/purchase request submits billing data to the FOPs supplied by the passenger and, if payment is authorized, creates a PNR.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Manage Your Booking – Change Itinerary Flow Services
Manage Your Booking Change Itinerary (MYB: CI)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking - Cancel and Refund Flow (MYB: CR)

Nodes.Text: *Digital Connect* services allow Airlines to support the following scenario in the MYB:CR (Manage Your Booking: Cancel and Refund) flow:

* Cancel and refund is supported for PNRs that have been paid with a single FOP (i.e. Credit Card only), being refunded to original form of payment.
  All ancillaries and seats which are existing in the booking will be forfeited.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Manage Your Booking - Cancel and Refund Flow Services

Nodes.Text:
To make use of the services cancel booked flights and get refund, use
the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.

The [/pnr/cancelAndRefund]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelAndRefund/retrievePnr) service GET operation initializes Cancellation process, validates MYB rules (separately for logged-in and guest user) and returns information for the PNR specified by the parameters (PNR locator, first name, last name and email).
If there is PNR found, all the flight details are returned (including the payment details).

This request creates a session and a conversation. From the response, collect the execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which can be used in subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
The response header contains the Execution key that is used to keep session information later on (e.g. Execution: e1s1).

Use [/pnr/CancelAndRefund/cancel]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelAndRefund/cancelPnr) request, GET operation to obtain information about refund targets and cancel fees (GET request is based on the information stored in the session).

If the passenger accepts the calculated refund amount, use [/pnr/CancelAndRefund/confirm]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelAndRefund/confirmCancel) request, POST operation to finalize the 'Cancel and Refund' process and to get the cancellation refunds.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Manage Your Booking - Cancel and Refund Flow Services
Manage Your Booking Cancel and Refund (MYB: CR)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking - Modify Trip Options Flow (MYB: MTO)

Nodes.Text: This group of services provides functionality that enables an Airline to present existing bookings for modifications by passengers. Passengers who retrieve bookings can add/remove seats, ancillaries and baggage, or change passenger details.

Any changes that the passenger makes to their journey are reflected in the PNR. After each modification,
the passenger's shopping cart is updated to show the old and the new selections together with their prices.
*Digital Connect* supports MYB: MTO flow (*Refund and New Sale*) and the new MYB:MTO flow:

* **Original handling for ancillaries** (*Refund and New Sale*): when the passenger wants to change the quantity, the previously purchased ancillaries are refunded/forfeited (based on AE ancillary indicator) and new ancillaries (with the new quantity) are purchased. These are two separate actions (*Refund/Forfeit* and *New Sale*).
* **Original handling for seats** (*Refund and New Sale*): when the passenger wants to change seat(s), the previously purchased seat(s) are refunded/forfeited (based on AE ancillary indicator) and new seats are purchased. These are two separate actions (*Refund/Forfeit* and *New Sale*).
* **Additional handling for baggage ancillaries** (i.e. ability to purchase additional baggage): when the passenger wants to increase the count/weight of baggage, the originally purchased baggage ancillaries are left as they are and a new purchase transaction (for additional baggage ancillaries) is performed.
* **An ability to pay for the changes made to either seats or ancillaries**: the passenger sees which Forms of Payment can be used to pay for changes and/or additions of seats or ancillaries, i.e. to purchase ancillaries or seats that have been added or changed.

* The Airline gives the passenger the option to retrieve a booking and modify ancillary and seat selections.
* The passenger supplies the information needed to retrieve the booking.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Modify Trip Options Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the services, use the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.
The passenger clicks the Make Changes button and a list of servicing options for ancillaries and seats opens. The passenger selects one of the options:

* In case of "Add ancillaries" option, submit [/pnr/mto/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/retrievePnrForMtoAncillaries) GET request to initialize **Modify Trip Options: Ancillaries Flow** and to return PNR data for provided input parameters that identify the PNR.
  * This service also evaluates MYB rules which are also returned in tripOptions section of the response.
  * After this service has been called, the application can prompt the passenger to add ancillaries (via [/pnr/mto/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/updateAncillaries) POST operation), seats (via [/pnr/mto/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/selectSeats) POST operation), or both, in any order.
* The Modify Trip Options flow can also be initialized by calling [/pnr/mto/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/retrievePnrForMtoSeats), but in that case it is the **Modify Trip Options: Seats Flow**, and passengers have only the option the add or modify their seat selection (via [/pnr/mto /products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/selectSeats) POST operation).

This request creates a session and a conversation. From the
response, collect the execution is, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which you use in subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and
conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
In response header you get Execution key that will be used to keep session information later on (e.g. Execution: e1s1).

At any time after an itinerary has been stored in the session, use [/pnr/mto/products]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/getBreakdown) GET operation to obtain a current list with prices of products that the passenger has added to the itinerary. Use this information to build and display a shopping cart.
You can build and display a shopping cart on every page of the passenger's interface.
After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /pnr/mto/passengers operations to add passengers to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/pnr/mto/passengers/contactAddress]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/changeTripContactDetails) POST request to change Trip Contact Info data.
* Submit a [/pnr/mto/passengers/contactAddress]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/getTripContactDetails) GET request to display the current Trip Contact Info data for the itinerary.

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /pnr/mto/products/ancillaries operations to show passengers the ancillaries available on the flights they have selected and to add any ancillaries selected by the passenger
to the itinerary. Requests must include the header data, execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie and SSWGID from the original search response to maintain the session.

* Submit a [/pnr/mto/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/getAncillaries) GET request to obtain a list of ancillaries available for the flights in the itinerary.
  * You can display these ancillaries to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/mto/products/ancillaries]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/updateAncillaries) POST request to add ancillaries to the itinerary.
  * You can use POST to update by submitting all of the ancillary data including the updated fields, and to delete ancillaries from the itinerary by submitting all of the ancillary data, including blank fields for the deleted ancillaries.

After an itinerary has been stored in the session, use /pnr/mto/products/seats operations to show passengers the seats available on the flights they have selected and to add any seats selected by the passenger to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/pnr/mto/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/getSeatsMap) GET request to the information used to construct seat maps for the flights in the itinerary. The seat information indicates available seats and reserved seats, free seats and paid seats, and so on.
  * You can use this information to format a seat map for display to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/mto/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/selectSeats) POST request to add seats to the itinerary.
  * You can use POST to update by submitting all of the seat data including the updated fields, and to delete seats from the itinerary by submitting all of the seat data, including blank fields for the deleted seats.
After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session, including ancillaries and seats use /pnr/mto/paymentOptions to retrieve available FOPs.

* Submit a [/pnr/mto/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/getCombinability) GET request to obtain a list of available forms of payment (FOP) and amounts (surcharges included).
  * You can display these forms of payment to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/mto/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/calculateSecondFopResidualValues) POST request to send FOP code with amount to get in the response a list with all combinable forms of payment with amount (residual amount).

After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session, including ancillaries and seats, collect payment data from the passenger and submit a [/pnr/mto/purchase]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fmto/purchaseBookingUpdate) request.
The /pnr/mto/purchase request submits billing data to the FOPs supplied by the passenger and, if payment is authorized, adds remarks to the PNR.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite - Modify Trip Options Flow Services
Manage Your Booking Modify Trip Options (MYB: MTO)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking - Change Passengers Details Flow (MYB: CPD)

Nodes.Text:
Airlines have the ability to decide if they want to allow the passengers to change the passenger
details they provided in the booking once the booking is already
completed.
In the MYB: Change Passenger Details flow the Airlines can offer their passengers the ability to:

* add or modify passenger details
* modify regular IATA SSRs and travel documents

Passenger details include information such as phone number, email
address, or Frequent Flyer number, whereas Special Service Requests
refer to the passenger's meal and seat preference, special needs
requests, travel documents, and visa information.

The Airline determines which passenger's details can be changed by
setting up rules.

* The Airline gives the passenger the option to retrieve a booking.
* The passenger supplies the information needed to retrieve the booking.

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Change Passenger Details Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the services, i.e. allow the passengers to change the passenger details they provided in the booking once the booking is already completed, use the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.
The passenger can select itinerary to be exchanged.
When the passenger updates the passenger data (e.g. passport number), update the passenger's PNR with a [/pnr/passengers]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fpassengers/changePassengersData) POST request.
This service adds or updates trip contact information for the current booking, during the MYB change passenger flow.
Update the passenger's PNR with a [/pnr/passengers/contactAddress]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fpassengers/changeTripContactDetails) POST request.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Change Passenger Details Flow Services
Manage Your Booking Change Passengers Details (MYB: CPD)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking: Flat Fee Upgrade flow (MYB: FFU)

Nodes.Text: Flat Fee Upgrade Flow (FFU) gives passengers an option to upgrade their existing booking to a higher cabin class for a flat fee. The flat fee amount is in most cases cheaper than the actual upgrade amount and usually more restrictive as the Airline can decide to enforce the fare rules of the original fare rather than the fare rules associated with the higher cabin.

FFU feature allows passengers to purchase an upgrade
if seats are available in a dedicated booking class. This flow allows Airlines to maximize revenue by selling available seats in higher cabins.

Flat Fee Upgrade flow can be configured as either cash or points so that the passengers on the Payment page
(on the Airline's UI) do not have an option to decide how they want to pay for their upgrade as
the Airline defines the form of payment.
The Airline needs to:

* enable either FFU or FQTU, cannot enable both
* map the booking classes for the relevant upgrade booking class
* file upgrade as OC/AE in ATPCO/Merchandising Manager.

* FFU is supported only on the Airline's own carrier, and is not supported for codeshare or interline carriers.
* Split PNR functionality is not supported, therefore, all passengers in the PNR must be upgraded.
* The Airline must file ancillary per segment (not itinerary part).
* Only EMD-A (associated with the flight) can be issued for the upgrade.
* Only free of charge seats are supported in the new upgraded cabin.

Nodes.Title: Using the DC Service Suite - Post Booking Flat Fee Upgrade Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the Flat Fee Upgrade services and complete the purchase of selected booking, use the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.
The passenger can select itinerary to be exchanged.

After the passenger selects a flight to be upgraded, use [/pnr/upgrade]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/retrievePnrForFfu) request, GET operation to check if PNR is eligible for upgrade, to initialize an Upgrade process.

This request creates a session and a conversation. From the
response, collect the execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which you will use in subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
In response header you get Execution key that will be used to keep session information later on (e.g. Execution: e1s1).

Nodes.Title: Display and Selection of Upgrade Offers

Nodes.Text:
After the passenger selects the flight, use [/pnr/upgrade/offers]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getUpgradeOffers) GET operation to
check if there are available travel extras upgrade offers e.g. cabin upgrades.

* If upgrade offers are available, you receive a list that can be formatted and displayed to the passenger.
* If upgrade offers are not available, the information about exception is sent instead.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Display and Selection of Upgrade Offers

Nodes.Text: After the passenger selects one or more upgrades, use [/pnr/upgrade/offers]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/updateAncillaries) POST operation to add the upgrades to the itinerary and store it in the session.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the DC Service Suite - Post Booking Flat Fee Upgrade Flow Services

Nodes.Text: After the passenger selects and confirms offer upgrade use /pnr/upgrade/products/seats operations to show the available seats in the upgraded cabin and to add any seats selected by the passenger to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/pnr/upgrade/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getSeatsMap) GET request to the information used to construct seat maps for the flights in the itinerary.
  * The seat information indicates available seats and reserved seats, free seats and paid seats, and so on.
  * Use this information to format a seat map for display to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/upgrade/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/selectSeats) POST request to add seats to the itinerary.
  * You can use POST to update by submitting all of the seat data including the updated fields, and to delete seats from the itinerary by submitting all of the seat data including blank fields for the deleted seats.

After the passenger has selected upgrade and seats use
[/pnr/upgrade/products]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getBreakdown) GET to request the latest price breakdown for current booking. The data is collected from the session, so no downline calls are necessary.
You can format price breakdown for display to the passenger in the shopping cart.

After the passenger has completed upgrade process use
[/pnr/upgrade/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getCombinability) GET request to obtain a list of available forms of payment (FOP) and amounts (surcharges included).
Currently, only final FOPs are supported for upgrades, and point payment is not allowed. You can display these forms of payment to the passenger for selection.

After the passenger has completed building the itinerary in the session, including ancillaries and seats, collect payment data from the passenger and submit a [/pnr/upgrade/purchase]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/purchaseBookingUpdate) POST request.
The /pnr/upgrade/purchase request submits billing data to the FOPs supplied by the passenger and, if payment is authorized, adds remarks to the PNR.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Manage Your Booking Flat Fee Upgrade (MYB: FFU)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking - Frequent Flyer Upgrade Flow (MYB: FQTU)

Nodes.Text: This is the Flow for processing both Upgrades and Upgrade Requests.

Frequent Traveler Upgrade (FQTU) flow allows the passengers to put themselves
on a waitlist even if no upgrades are immediately available.
If the waitlist is successfully confirmed, smartflow processes the upgrade
and automatically deduct points from the Frequent Flyer
account that should be paid for the upgrade.
The Airline's UI has an option to re-direct the passenger from the Manage Your Booking: Modify Trip Options Flow (MYB: MTO) to Manage Your Booking: Frequent Traveler Upgrade Flow (MYB: FQTU).

* The only supported form of payment is points.
* For the waitlisted segments smartflow, the system which processes the payment
  for upgrades (that become confirmed) does not support Credit Card (cash) payment.
* DC does not store Credit Card details.
* FQTU is supported only on the Airline's own carrier, and is not supported for codeshare or interline carriers.
* Split PNR functionality is not supported, therefore, all passengers in the PNR must be upgraded.
* At least one passenger must have an active Frequent Flyer number stored in the PNR.
* Only EMD-A (associated with the flight) can be issued for the upgrade.
* Only free of charge seats are supported in the new upgraded cabin.
* FFU/FQTU do not support discounts and Airlines should not file discounts for Upgrade offerings/ancillaries in Dynamic Retailer.
The Airline needs to:

* set up the FQTU table in the host
* map the booking classes for the relevant upgrade booking class
* file upgrade as OC/AE in ATPCO/Merchandising Manager.

* The Airline gives the passenger an option to retrieve a booking and exchange booked flights.
* The passenger supplies the information needed to retrieve the booking.

Nodes.Title: Using the DC Service Suite – Post Booking Frequent Flyer Upgrade Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the services, use them in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.
The passenger can select itinerary to be exchanged.

This operation evaluates the passenger and the booking (e.g. evaluating booking class which is not upgradeable or all segments are already waitlisted or confirmed) against any restrictions in MYB rules to determine if the passenger can proceed with FQTU upgrade flow.
After the passenger clicks the Upgrade link, call [/pnr/upgrade]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/retrievePnrForFfu) GET and evaluate again if the passenger can proceed with FQTU upgrade flow.
FQTU flow is initialized.

If all the MYB rules checks are completed, call [/pnr/upgrade/offers]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getUpgradeOffers) GET and shop for any upgrade offers available. UI re-directs the passenger to the Upgrade page where the upgrade offers are displayed.

* If there is availability for the upgrade booking class, DC returns the upgrade offers (represented by ancillaries). Offers are received per segment, so the exact prices applied to the itinerary are known.
* If there is no current availability for the upgrade booking class, DC provides option to put the passenger on a waitlist. The passenger can be notified via mail that they are upgraded to the higher cabin.
Additionally, if there is no confirmed or waitlisted offer for the particular segment, DC returns information why there is no upgrade offer returned:

* `NOT_OFFERED` means that ancillary was not filed for this PNR
* `REJECTED` means that ancillary was return but Host command rejected upgrade
* `ALREADY_CONFIRMED` that this segment is already upgraded
* `ALREADY_WAITLISTED` that this segment is already waitlisted

If the passenger is not logged in and the passenger makes the
selection, show the login component and prompt the passenger for the login credentials (the passenger needs to be logged in before making all selects of any FQTU upgrades as this is a points-only flow).
Call [/login]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveLoginResult) POST to log in the passenger to their FF account and to retrieve the passenger's points balance.

When the passenger selects the upgrade option, call POST
[/pnr/upgrade/offers]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/updateAncillaries) to select an upgrade offer.
DC validates if the passenger is logged in and has sufficient point balance for the selected upgrade offer(s), including waitlisted segment(s).

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the DC Service Suite – Post Booking Frequent Flyer Upgrade Flow Services

Nodes.Text: After the passenger selects and confirms offer upgrade use /pnr/upgrade/products/seats operations to show the available seats in the upgraded cabin and to add any seats selected by the passenger to the itinerary.

* Submit a [/pnr/upgrade/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getSeatsMap) GET request to the information used to construct seat maps for the flights in the itinerary.
  * The seat information indicates available seats and reserved seats, free seats and paid seats, and so on.
  * Use this information to format a seat map for display to the passenger for selection.
* Submit a [/pnr/upgrade/products/seats]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/selectSeats) POST request to add seats to the itinerary.
  * You can use POST to update by submitting all of the seat data including the updated fields, and to delete seats from the itinerary by submitting all of the seat data including blank fields for the deleted seats.

After the passenger has selected upgrade and seats use
[/pnr/upgrade/products]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getBreakdown) GET to request the latest price breakdown for current booking. The data is collected from the session, so no downline calls are necessary.
You can format price breakdown for display to the passenger in the shopping cart.

After the passenger has completed upgrade process use
[/pnr/upgrade/paymentOptions]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getCombinability) GET request to obtain a list of available forms of payment (FOP) and amounts (surcharges included).
Response indicates that the only available form of payment is points as the FQTU is points-only flow.

When the passenger selects points as the type of payment, call GET [/pnr/upgrade/paymentOptions/details/AWARD]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/getAwardDetails) to obtain ancillary toggle that has only points option active.

When the passenger selects form of payment, completes the payment and decides to purchase, initiate the purchase by calling [/pnr/upgrade/purchase]($e/%2Fpnr%2Fupgrade/purchaseBookingUpdate) POST.
If authorization is successful, the /purchase service adds remarks to the PNR and Issue EMD-As for the confirmed upgrade.

The purchase response also contains information about the status of the requested upgrade (UpgradeInfo section in the PNR).
There is option to display a message reminding the passenger that they are on the upgrade waiting list, and a message stating the number of miles that will be redeemed if the requested upgrade is confirmed.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Manage Your Booking Frequent Flyer Upgrade (MYB: FQTU)

Nodes.Title: Manage Your Booking: Cancel Upgrade Flow

Nodes.Text: This group of services enables Airlines to allow passengers to cancel waitlisted segments.

Any changes that the passenger makes to their journey are reflected in the PNR. After each modification, the passenger's shopping cart is updated to show the old and new selections together with their prices.

* The Airline gives the passenger the option to retrieve a booking and upgrade their existing booking to a higher cabin class.
* The passenger supplies the information needed to retrieve the booking.

Nodes.Title: Using the DC Service Suite - Post Booking Cancel Upgrade Flow Services

Nodes.Text: To make use of the Cancel Upgrade services and remove waitlisted segments use the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
* If the passenger is not logged in and clicks a link to request cancellation, prompt the passenger for information that identifies a PNR (the passenger enters a path with PNR info).
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all the flight details are returned, including the payment details, such as forms of payment used.
This service evaluates the passenger and the booking against any restrictions in MYB rules to determine if the Cancel Upgrade flow is available (if the PNR contains at least one waitlisted segment).

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the DC Service Suite - Post Booking Cancel Upgrade Flow Services

Nodes.Text: When the passenger clicks the Cancel Upgrade, call [/pnr/cancelUpgrade]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelUpgrade/retrievePnrForCancelUpgrade) GET and evaluate the passenger and the booking against any restrictions in MYB rules to determine it. The Cancel Upgrade flow allows the passenger to select an option to remove himself from a waitlist if our application discovered an upgrade waitlisted segment in the booking.

This request will create a session and a conversation. From the
response, collect the execution id, JSESSIONID cookie, WLPCOOKIE cookie, and SSWGID cookie, which can be used in subsequent requests to maintain the session. For more information on creating and using sessions and conversations, see [Session Management]($__content/configuration/session_management.md).
The response header contains an Execution key that can be used to keep session information later on. (e.g. Execution : e1s1)

Nodes.Title: Display and Selection of Cancel Upgrade Offers

Nodes.Text: If all the MYB rules checks are completed, *Digital Connect* returns which segments have the option to cancel waitlisted upgrade by calling [/pnr/cancelUpgrade/offers]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelUpgrade/getUpgradeOffers) GET.
*Digital Connect* presents the passenger statuses of his segments (data is taken from SHP payfields from PNR):

* Segment is still available for upgrade/waitlist - `NOT_REQUESTED`
* Passenger's~~~~ upgrade has already been confirmed - `ALREADY_CONFIRMED`
* Passenger is currently on the upgrade waitlist, but can be removed from it - `ALREADY_WAITLISTED`.
If the passenger wants to remove himself from waitlist upgrade, call [/pnr/cancelUpgrade/offers]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelUpgrade/updateCancelUpgradeOffersSelection) POST.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Display and Selection of Cancel Upgrade Offers

Nodes.Text:
After the passenger has selected upgrade and seats use [/pnr/cancelUpgrade/products]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelUpgrade/getBreakdown) GET to request the latest price breakdown for current booking. The data is collected from the session so no downline calls are necessary. Price breakdown for display to the passenger in the shopping
cart can be formatted.

To finalize removing upgrade waitlist, call [/pnr/cancelUpgrade/confirm]($e/%2Fpnr%2FcancelUpgrade/confirmCancelUpgrade) POST.
Back end will execute host command to remove upgrade waitlist. SHP Payfields with stored payment details are removed as well.

This feature helps to manage bookings in case of an irregular operation e.g. scheduled change. The passengers are able to manage their own flights directly on web page using MYB path, instead of calling a call center.
This feature helps the Airline with:

* Managing offload from the plane
* Supporting SC/WK statuses
* Supporting involuntary changes (Manage Your Booking - Change Itinerary (MYB:CI) Flow / Manage Your Booking - Cancel and Refund (MYB:CR) Flow) e.g. fare difference waive, change fee waive, refund fee waive (based on rules set up in re-accommodation manager - Dynamic Retailer)
* Exercising promotions - fare difference waive, change fee waive, refund fee waive (based on rules set up in re-accommodation manager - Dynamic Retailer)

**NOTE**
In order to prevent passengers from using MYB:MTO (Modify Trip Options), BNPL (Book Now Pay Later), Manage Your Booking - Upgrade (MYB:FFU), Edit passenger flows under IROP conditions - additional rule was provided.
Entering above flows is disabled if:

* PNR flights with status SC/WK are present
* Segments from booking not match with segments in VCR

Nodes.Title: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Irregular Operations (IROPs)

Nodes.Text: To make use of the services to offer a self-service re-booking option to the passengers (that gives them control over IROPs events) use the services in the following order:
The passenger can retrieve a booking either by supplying basic PNR information or by logging into a Frequent Flyer account.

* If the passenger is logged in, retrieve all their reservations by calling [/profile/mytrips]($e/%2Fprofile/retrieveMyTrips) GET.
* If the passenger is not logged in, prompt passengers for information that identifies a PNR, retrieve the information, and format it for display to the passenger.
  * The [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) service GET operation returns information about the PNR specified in the parameters.
  * If the PNR is found, all flight details are returned, including the payment details such as forms of payment used.
The passenger can select itinerary to be exchanged.
Retrieve [/pnr]($e/%2Fpnr/retrievePnr) and set SC/WK status on flight that is under IROP situation using eligibilities field.

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Using the Digital Connect Service Suite – Irregular Operations (IROPs)

Nodes.Text: Call [pnr/offloadpassenger]($e/%2Fpnr%2Firops/offLoadPassenger) (optional) to checkout passengers by changing VCR status from CKIN to OK, which gives passengers an option to initiate an exchange or refund process.

**NOTE**
The Airline is responsible for passing information that the irregular operations event occurred and passenger's reservation can be applicable for exchange or refund with benefits (based on rules defined in the re-accommodation manager).
The [/pnr/irop]($e/%2Fpnr%2Firops/acceptNewSegments) service is executed in order to "clean up" the PNR (when reservation contains WK/SC flight statuses), before entering the Exchange path.
In case of irregular operation occurrence the /pnr/irop retrieves the PNR and confirms initialization of the Exchange flow.

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Payment data required to purchase a booking.

body.title: PaymentData
body.description: Payment data required to purchase a booking.

paymentRequired.description: Flag indicating if payment is required or not.

payment.description: List with used payments. The request should contain at least one instance of /payment.

cancelURL.description: Context parameter - cancel URL.

payerId.description: ID of the payer needed for 2nd PayPal request.

accountNumber.description: Bank account number. Required for ELV transaction.

countryCode.description: Code of the country where the bank is located (two letters ISO country code like : https://en.wikipedia.org/?title=ISO_3166-1).

sortCode.description: Six digit code that identifies the bank and the branch where account is held. Required for ELV transaction.

bankName.description: The name of account holder's bank.

allOf.description: Code of payment outside of the Digital Connect when using for example BPC.

defaultURL.description: Holds the default URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification.

pendingURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification while the operation is pending.

approvedURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when it has been approved.

declinedURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when it has been declined.

errorURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when during the process an error has been encountered.

cancelURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when the operation has been cancelled.

mac.description: Secret key used to validate response from the redirect.

months.description: Selected amount of monthly installments (available options are configurable). Used when installment source in payment options service is CONFIGURATION. It should not be present when installment source in payment options service is PAYMENT_PROVIDER.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

exchangeRate.description: Exchange rate between the price in the original currency and price in the Credit Card currency (including the marginPercentRate).

exchangeRateSource.description: The source of an exchange rate.

supplierId.description: The merchant providing the dynamic currency conversion service.

passengerIndex.description: Index of the passenger expressed as a positive integer.

items.title: DCCPassengerDocumentDetail

selectedDCCOffer.description: Details of the Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) offer.
selectedDCCOffer.title: DCCPaymentOffer

expDate.description: Expiration date in the format: YYYY-MM-DD. Required for GIFT_CARD.

currency.description: Currency - Three letter ISO code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 or 'FFCURRENCY' for points/miles.

billingData.title: BillingData
billingData.description: Billing address information for the purchase.

street1.description: First line of street address.

street2.description: Second line of street address like apartment number.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

fraudNetData.title: FraudNetData
fraudNetData.description: Additional data about the user browser, used by Fraud check providers to validate transaction.

timestamp.description: Point of Sale date and time of the purchase passed for the Fraud check operation in format: YYYY-MM-DD.

ipAddress.description: The user IP address passed for the Fraud Check operation.

prefix.title: Prefix2
prefix.description: Passenger prefix or title, accepts lower and upper case letters (prefix values read from pnr will be in upper case letters to accommodate this, upper case is also accepted).

suffix.title: Suffix2
suffix.description: Passenger suffix, accepts lower and upper case letters (suffix values read from the PNR will be in upper case letters to accommodate this, upper case is also accepted).

street1.description: First line of street address specifying building number, street name etc.

street2.description: Second line of street address specifying apt, suite etc.

postcode.description: Postal or Zip code of the address.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

email.description: Email address of the logged in user.

tierLevel.description: Logged in user's frequent flyer member level.

tierStatus.description: Logged in user's frequent flyer status.

issueDate.description: Issue date of FF account in the format: YYYY-MM-DD.

remarksAndSSRs.title: RemarksAndSSRs
remarksAndSSRs.description: Messages that can be added to the PNR.

remarks.description: List of remarks to be stored in the PNR.

otherServiceInformation.description: List of OSI to be stored in the PNR.

specialServiceRequests.description: List of SSR (Special Service Request) to be stored in the PNR.

items.title: SpecialServiceRequest
items.description: Special Service Request (SSR) to be stored in the PNR.

passengerIndex.description: Index of the passenger associated with the Special Service Request (SSR), expressed as a positive integer.

passengerNameNumber.description: Passenger's name number. Either input passenger name number or passenger index, no need to enter both.

segmentKey.title: SegmentKey
segmentKey.description: Segment key to associate fare rules, seat map segment etc.

origin.description: Origin airport code (IATA 3 letter code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_airports_by_IATA_code:_A).

destination.description: Destination airport code (IATA 3 letter code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_airports_by_IATA_code:_A).

departure.description: Departure date time, in the format: YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS.

arrival.description: Arrival date time, in the format: YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS.

profileInput.title: ProfileInput
profileInput.description: Input information for profile created in the booking path.

create.description: Set to true to create profile during booking.

username.description: User name for user profile create in booking path.

password.description: Password for user profile create in booking path.

queuePlacementData.title: QueuePlacementData
queuePlacementData.description: Queue number and prefatory instruction code used to place the PNR in a specific queue.

queueNumber.description: Queue number used to specify the required queue.

instructionCode.description: Prefatory instruction code for given queue.

Nodes.Title: Return Combinability Mapping
Nodes.Name: getPaymentOptions
Nodes.Description: Returns combinability mapping. This information will allow to display proper payment methods and allow multiple forms of payment. It also provides information which products are paid separately so we can provide more flexibility to a user.

allOf.description: Code of payment outside of the Digital Connect when using for example BPC.

months.description: Selected amount of monthly installments (available options are configurable). Used when installment source in payment options service is CONFIGURATION. It should not be present when installment source in payment options service is PAYMENT_PROVIDER.

Nodes.Title: Book Car
Nodes.Name: bookCar
Nodes.Description: Performs the car booking for the available offer in a JSON format. The response contains the confirmation message and booked car details.

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: JSON request with the selected available car details, driver details, etc.

body.title: CarReservationRequest
body.description: JSON request with the selected available car details, driver details, etc.

pnr.description: PNR corresponding to the flight reservation.

pickUpLocation.title: CarDepotLocation
pickUpLocation.description: Contains all the information about car depot location.

carLocationId.title: CarLocationId
carLocationId.description: Contains information about car rental location.

code.description: Location code of the car depot - format depends on the codeContext.

codeContext.description: Car service provider's context of the returned codes.

atAirport.description: Flag indicating if the depot is at the airport or not.

street1.description: First line of street address specifying building number, street name etc.

street2.description: Second line of street address specifying apt, suite etc.

postcode.description: Postal or Zip code of the address.

phones.description: List of depot's available contact numbers.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

dropOffLocation.title: CarDepotLocation
dropOffLocation.description: Contains all the information about car depot location.

carLocationId.title: CarLocationId
carLocationId.description: Contains information about car rental location.

code.description: Location code of the car depot - format depends on the codeContext.

codeContext.description: Car service provider's context of the returned codes.

atAirport.description: Flag indicating if the depot is at the airport or not.

street1.description: First line of street address specifying building number, street name etc.

street2.description: Second line of street address specifying apt, suite etc.

postcode.description: Postal or Zip code of the address.

phones.description: List of depot's available contact numbers.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

pickUpDateTime.description: Car's pickup date and time, in the format: YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS.

dropOffDateTime.description: Car's drop-off date and time, in the format: YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS.

prefix.title: Prefix2
prefix.description: Passenger prefix or title, accepts lower and upper case letters (prefix values read from pnr will be in upper case letters to accommodate this, upper case is also accepted).

drivers.description: List of secondary drivers. It might be the list of all eligible passengers that want to drive, excluding the primary driver.

prefix.title: Prefix2
prefix.description: Passenger prefix or title, accepts lower and upper case letters (prefix values read from pnr will be in upper case letters to accommodate this, upper case is also accepted).

primaryDriverCitizenship.description: Primary driver's citizenship ISO country code (two letters) like: https://en.wikipedia.org/?title=ISO_3166-1.

street1.description: First line of street address specifying building number, street name etc.

street2.description: Second line of street address specifying apt, suite etc.

postcode.description: Postal or Zip code of the address.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

pricedCar.title: PricedCar
pricedCar.description: Detailed description of the rental car, including its availability, features and all associated charges.

signature.description: A JWT token (see: https://jwt.io/). Signature and data used for signing. It can be validated by Digital Connect if provided object is correct and no price was changed without authorization.

features.title: CarFeatures
features.description: Contains the information about available car's features.

fuelType.title: FuelType1
fuelType.description: Type of the fuel a vehicle's engine uses.

numberOfDoors.description: The number of the vehicle's doors.

airCondition.description: Flag indicating if air condition is present.

capacity.title: Capacity
capacity.description: Describes vehicle capacity for passengers and baggage.

passengers.description: Number of passengers that can be accommodated by this vehicle.

baggage.description: Number of bags/suitcases that can be accommodated by this vehicle.

vendorReference.title: VendorReference
vendorReference.description: Information identifying this availability quote. Some Provider expect it to match exactly as returned in availability Response for desired Vehicle.

url.description: URL that identifies the location associated with the record identified by the unique ID. Provided by the vendor in the car availability response as an encoded string. Hence it will not be validated at this level.

identifier.description: Used to provide a required unique identifier.

type.description: A reference to the type of the object defined by the Unique ID element.

dateTime.description: The date and time at which this availability quote was made available.

companyDetails.title: CompanyDetails
companyDetails.description: Company details associated with the unique ID.

division.description: The division name or ID with which the contact is associated.

department.description: The department name or ID with which the contact is associated.

instance.description: Record identification used in update messages. It assures the server that sent update refers to the most recent modification (of the updated object).

codeContext.description: Name of the car service provider.

rentalRate.title: RentalRate
rentalRate.description: Rate definition associated with offered vehicle.

currency.description: Currency - Three letter ISO code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 or 'FFCURRENCY' for points/miles.
Currency - Three letter ISO code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 or 'FFCURRENCY' for points/miles.
Currency - Three letter ISO code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 or 'FFCURRENCY' for points/miles.

rateQualifier.title: RateQualifier
rateQualifier.description: Indicates the type of rates applicable to the customer.

availabilityStatus.title: AvailabilityStatus
availabilityStatus.description: Defines a set of valid status values, allowing the selection of a specific group based on its availability or just the disclosure of the reservation status.

distanceRestriction.title: DistanceRestriction
distanceRestriction.description: Distance restriction defined for the rented vehicle.

period.title: Period
period.description: Time period for which the restriction is defined.

distance.title: Distance
distance.description: The distance limit that the rented vehicle can make free of charge per unit.

unlimited.description: Flag indicating that there is no limit on distance. If set to true - both unit and limit are not present.

holderName.description: Credit Card holder name as on card.

prefix.title: Prefix2
prefix.description: Passenger prefix or title, accepts lower and upper case letters (prefix values read from pnr will be in upper case letters to accommodate this, upper case is also accepted).

suffix.title: Suffix2
suffix.description: Passenger suffix, accepts lower and upper case letters (suffix values read from the PNR will be in upper case letters to accommodate this, upper case is also accepted).

expirationDate.description: Credit Card expiration date in the format: YYYY-MM-DD.

installmentId.description: Installment ID. Used when installment source in payment options service is PAYMENT_PROVIDER. It should not be present when installment source in payment options service is CONFIGURATION.

bankName.description: Installment bank name. Used when installment source in payment options service is CONFIGURATION. It should not be present when installment source in payment options service is PAYMENT_PROVIDER.

months.description: Selected amount of monthly installments (available options are configurable). Used when installment source in payment options service is CONFIGURATION. It should not be present when installment source in payment options service is PAYMENT_PROVIDER.

countryCode.description: Phone country code (ISO country code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_code).

redirectUrlData.title: RedirectUrlData
redirectUrlData.description: Data regarding AFOP or Dynamic 3ds redirection urls, required for the 1st request.

defaultURL.description: Holds the default URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification.

pendingURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification while the operation is pending.

approvedURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when it has been approved.

declinedURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when it has been declined.

errorURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when during the process an error has been encountered.

cancelURL.description: Holds the URL where the client would like to post the result of the 3rd party verification when the operation has been cancelled.

verificationResult.description: Verification Result for 3DS context second pass.

received3rdPartyData.title: Received3rdPartyData
received3rdPartyData.description: Data obtained after returning from 3rd party redirection, required for the 2nd AFOP or Dynamic 3DS request.

mac.description: Secret key used to validate response from the redirect.

smsCode.description: SMS code for card authorization verification.

selectedDCCOffer.title: DCCPaymentOffer
selectedDCCOffer.description: Details of the Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) offer.

currency.description: Currency - Three letter ISO code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 or 'FFCURRENCY' for points/miles.
Currency - Three letter ISO code like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 or 'FFCURRENCY' for points/miles.

exchangeRate.description: Exchange rate between the price in the original currency and price in the Credit Card currency (including the marginPercentRate).

exchangeRateSource.description: The source of an exchange rate.

supplierId.description: The merchant providing the dynamic currency conversion service.

items.title: DCCPassengerDocumentDetail
items.description: Dynamic Currency Conversion(DCC) details of the passenger and the passenger’s document.

passengerIndex.description: Index of the passenger expressed as a positive integer.
